Reviews.Title: “they dont respect their clients”
Reviews.Author: kalia1985
Reviews.Content: despite i have read many bad reviews i made a reservation for 2 days because there was a very good price. Anyway the thing is the only i asked was to have a quiet room because i was the whole day out and i wanted to rest. They put me in a room ground floor and even if i told them again the girl in the reception ensured me that it will be very very quiet! But no! At 7.30 the next morning people start talking ,they opened and closed doors all the time, the staff members were having a discussion outside of my window and on the top of that, they we doing also mentainance jobs. Anyway i am sure they had other rooms available but they chose to lie to us so that we stay downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Doors, doors, doors”
Reviews.Author: pgwkmt
Reviews.Content: Basic room, clean, did the job. Seemed to have to walk through about 25 doors to get to it from the front door. Unrelated, but signage is rubbish! Good value, breakfast was a bit hosteley but included in the price and was welcome. Easy to find so good location. Would stay again for a cheap night in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for budget trips”
Reviews.Author: AzmirDan
Reviews.Content: For me for budget trip, I can say that this hotel is good. The room that we booked was located at the ground floor and easy to access. Even the room is small, but it look fine to me. The hoyel location is very near to Metro Station and they are a laundry shop near by. And then, Tesco Mart at the same block.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: Brett E
Reviews.Content: Warning! If you want a horrible experience then stay at this crummy run down poorly managed hell hole! Stayed there over new years as my friends live in clapham. When we checked in we were greeted with the poorest reception. Hand in the face asking us not to speak. Indian owned and run it smelt like a curry house. Im not a racist but this was disgusting. THey did not speak english well and ignored many people who asked questions. We were not shown to our room and had to find it ourselves. (through 11 doors and crummy hallways dragging our luggage ourselves). Room HAD NO WI FI!!! None what so ever and when we asked reception we got a shrug of the shoulders and said that happens.... WE did pay for WI FI... TV reception was poor.. Hardly could see the TV because of the poor reception and static... Room was tiny...but semi clean.. hardest workers in that hotel were the cleaners... Management was beyond a joke and would highly reccommend anyone to stay clear from that establishment if u can call it that. Never written a review like this before but thought the poor poor disgusting customer service deserved it! Was a joke and will never be back to that hellhole!"

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible 'hotel' I have ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: Lenos T
Reviews.Content: The stay was simply dreadful. Upon arrival me and my girlfriend were allocated a single bedroom instead of a double for which we had paid. When we finally entered a second room (this time double) we only found out that the cupboards were broken, the heater had no adjustment so it was too hot at times, no hairdryer for my girlfriend, bad curtains, one window that wouldn't open out of the two, no toilet brush, and an unbelievably horrific bed, so uncomfortable due to the old mattress that we actually felt that we were sleeping on an iron fence. In spite of the above, it was a terrible mistake from my part not to sacrifice another couple hundred pounds and stay at at least what can be called a 'decent' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not so cheerful, try not to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: si_bush
Reviews.Content: You do get what you pay for and this is relatively cheap by London standards but is poor. I wouldn't recommend staying here. If you need somewhere to stay nearby the Balham Lodge B&B is good, don't try the other Euro Hotel it's just as bad as this one we found out the hard way. A new Travel Lodge is opening in Balham, that should fill the budget accommodation requirements in the area in the future, shame it wasn't there when we needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought It could have been”
Reviews.Author: gogirluk
Reviews.Content: Booked via Late Rooms as two single rooms where really really cheap as we had to stay in the area for one night for business. Parking is on the streets to the side of the Hotel, which is free from 6pm to 9am, should you arrive earlier, it will cost you Â£3 per hour to leave your car there. The Euro Hotel has a sister hotel a block from the Hotel which is called the Euro Lodge, so you could be sent a block away and have a little walk with your suitcases, so bear that in mind. There were no lifts I could see and the hotel is a bit of a rabbit warren of stairs. Our rooms were tiny but clean with all the basics including shower...very comfortable bed and I had a really good nights sleep. Breakfast IS basic with a choice of Rice Crispies, and toast to eat along with tea, coffee and juice. You do get what you pay for, but I think it could have been alot worse for the price we paid. A very nice bar and restaurant down the road which was called the Rook I believe, great food and lovely wine and next door to that a little shop which was handy.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ssk78
Reviews.Content: On the main freeway of a seedy location. Tiny rooms with closet-sized bathrooms,which aren't well maintained. The "free" internet only works in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good location and clean sheets”
Reviews.Author: FairyDust2285
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap hotel for a friend and I to stay in Friday and Saturday night. After spending ages searching on the internet I came across this hotel. I read the bad reviews and the few okish ones but thought that for the price (twin room Â£90 for the 2 nights) and location it was just what we wanted. I knew the hotel may not be great but decided to give it a go. I have to say that, although it was not a brilliant stay, both my friend and I would use the hotel again if we needed a hotel in London with an affordable price tag. It really was what you pay for. Clean sheets and a okish comfy bed. Small flat screen tv (no remote) and en-suite which was a small bath type thing with a shower over (loose fitting but didn't cause too many problems). There was a kettle tea and coffee and a hair dryer but we didn't use this as I always take my own. We were shattered both nights so slept quite well. I did wake up a couple of times due to squeaky floor boards and sounded like a couple arguing but I fell straight back to sleep. The main down side was that there were so so many flies in the room! The window was open we got in the room but I didn't want to close it as then the fly's couldn't get out! I don't think this was a fault of the hotel as to be honest fruit flies are just EVERYWHERE at the moment! It was a 2 minute walk to Clapham south and both Tesco's and Sainsburys. There are plenty of cheap eats for after a night out which was great for when we were nearly out of money!! If your after a cheap London stay and do not mind taking a pair of flip flops (I wore these at all times including in the shower - you never know whats been on any hotel floor!) then this is worth it. Its cheap and cheerful. Don't expect anything more than a bed, shower and basic breakfast (we did skip this so can't comment on quality, wetherspoons was one stop on the tube - Balham worth a visit if you want a cheap breakfast, you always know what your getting here).

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE, THIS "HOTEL" IS A DISGRACE”
Reviews.Author: julian e
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a work colleague for 7 nights. After one night, my colleague checked out due to the state of his room. His room was filthy( stained mattress and pillows) as well as unsafe wiring. The booking was paid for in advance and the hotel is now refusing to refund the money which is over Â£500. The pictures of the rooms on their website bear no resemblance to the rooms that you get to stay in. All in all this "hotel" ( i use the word hotel in the loose sense of the word!) is a joke albeit, not a particularly funny one. You would be better off sleeping in a tent on the common!

Reviews.Title: “Realistic review of a budget hotel!!GOOD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: Derek K
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Euro hotel in Clapham while visiting friends and family who live near-by. One hour after arriving in Luton airport we arrived at the hotel which is located on the lovely Clapham common park and RIGHT beside the tube station which makes it so so convenient to get to wherever your headed in London. Firstly check-in at reception. Has a small reception/breakfast area nothing to impressive but how much time will you be spending in reception!! Fairly quick check in with payment up front..no complaints. Up the very narrow stairs that is very dated along with most of the interior but again nothing outrageously bad here! The rooms are very small as is the bathroom but clean enough for my liking.small tv in the room too but didn't get watched! I have to stress that it's by no means luxury but is a perfect base to stay in.Unusual looking bath but the shower was fine but maybe pop to the tesco right up the street for extra shower gel and shampoo!! Linen and towels were all fine. This cost us 81 euro each for 3 nights which was a bargain. My reason for the poor service vote is basically because we didn't use any services being honest! I can recommend the pizzeria just a few doors up great value and very good pizza! We had a brilliant weekend and overall the euro hotel in clapham is a budget hotel which is ideal for someone staying for a weekend that would prefer that extra cash for the shops,bars and lovely restaurants that London has to offer!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the cricket but poor room and vile breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Greggbb
Reviews.Content: I will keep this simple... The Euro Hotel is in a great location for the cricket at the Oval. It also isn't far from central London and very near Clapham South tube station. It is just opposite the common which is nice in the sun. It is in a pleasant part of town, close to local shops, bars and other amenities. It is also cheap if you book at the right time, it is reasonably clean given the price and general staff are polite enough. The bad news is the breakfast is horrendous, it is a run down hotel, and the bed are not clean at all. The three of us had three uncomfortable single beds, they were not clean and the room really needed a lick of paint. The en-suite was fine. Shower was ok. The place looks odd from the outside and very run-down inside. It is a rabbit warren of a place. Certainly not for families or people wanting luxury! It is for backpacking, cheap sleeps and the cricket. My major problem was when I tried to alter my booking from a 3 person room to a 2 person room. This was not possible without paying again (twice what we originally paid for the room in the first place!). I can't understand the point of the inflexibility. It is just poor customer service. Luckily I found a friend who was up for the cricket, and filled the place. That is not the point, though.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Spend your Money there, You wont get it back”
Reviews.Author: pitocha38
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Booking .com When I arrived and I checked the room I found it filthy place with mould in the pillows and in the bathrooms tiles. Hairs into the shower and holes in the Flor . So I asked them to change me the room but it was most of the same. I asked them to check me out and refund the money but they offered to show me 10 rooms more.After 4 rooms all in the same state I decided to stay in one because it was late at night. After 20 min in the room a terrible noise came from a cupboard . when I opened I found out a boiler making a noise as an engine on a ship. I checked out writing a complaint form and they refused to refund the money. I took the case to booking. co who was incapable of helping me and after several emails to the hotel with no response at all, i will take it to citizen advise. So please don't jeopardize your time and money, this is a filthy place with no consideration for costumers

Reviews.Title: “Ok Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whitstable1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in May out of neccessity not for pleasure. My first advice is don't try to check in before 3pm as you will be turned away. Our 1st Twin Room was little more than a cupboard facing the Common but therefore also facing the main thoroughfare. As it was hot we had the window open but the traffic noise was unbearable. So I would suggest forego the view if you want to sleep and ask for a room at the back. 2nd time we had a triple room which was much more spacious. Continental breakfast was included but consisted of 2 kinds of cereal and toast. Hardly Continental. On the up side the staff were friendly and compared to other hotels nearby it was half the price or less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and decent value”
Reviews.Author: crmpicco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a three night stay at the Euro Hotel in Clapham (formally known as the Dudley Hotel). Overall it was a pleasant stay and for the price paid and considering we didn't spend much time there it was good value. The area of Clapham is very nice and peaceful with the hotel facing Clapham Common Southside. The hotel is also only a 2 minute minute walk from the Clapham South underground station and a 10 minute walk from the Clapham Common underground station. Our room (733) was very small it has to be said, but it wasn't a major issue. The breakfasts were also very basic (cereal, tea/coffee, toast). No cooked breakfast option but this is reflected in the price. Friendly staff and free wifi was on offer so I would say i'd recommend this hotel if you are looking for a cheap place to put your head down comfortably in piece and quiet. However, if you are looking for somewhere to spend a while then this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE and do NOT use ebookers fo booking of hotels”
Reviews.Author: adriadri_10
Reviews.Content: I made the huge mistake of trusting in a reservation made by ebookers and emailed to me as confirmed for this hotel. It was a very difficult week to get a decent hotel around London due to Wimbledon. However a very polite agent said he could help me and he "got" me a hotel room. At my arrival at 10:30 pm a very rude and apatic receptionist simply told me that the booking never reached me even though I had a HOTEL BOOKING CONFIRMATION number, While ringing ebookers to complain I witnessed how books were given to acquintances of the recption staff and people with valid reservations were left on the street, Ebookers didn't even apologise and they said they were going to try to find me an accommodation somewher else and promised to ring me back. After midnight I had to ring them back and had to explain my situation to a new agent from scratch. When finally they rang me back hey offered me a hotel 30 miles away from London. In the meantime I had been harrased by an overfriendly member of the staff who kept insisting me on dragging me to lonley places in the hotel and when I rejected the offer he even pulled my arm really hard hurting me in the process. I would have called the police if I hadn't been scared to be kicked out after midnight in a horrible neighbourhood and several meters away from any public transport. The hotel looked dirty and rundown and deep down I was pleased I didn't have to stay there. Awful with scary and abusive staff. And NEVER use ebookers. They are irresponsible and lie to you when they confirm a booking.

Reviews.Title: “It was terrible - avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PVBARMI
Reviews.Content: Night 1: during the check in immediately asked for my card and initiated the payment for all 4 nights. The hotel bought in the neighbourhood normal flats and placed us there without any notification. We had to carry our heavy luggages on our own to floor 2. We noticed that beside our room there was a room under construction...and THE BEST during the first night: there was NO LIGHT IN THE ROOM!!! The receptionist expressed his apologize and told to send someone by tomorrow and provided a small unusable lamp... Day 1: as we noticed previous night that the room beside is under construction...the workers started at 7 AM polishing the wall and woke us up... Night 2: as we came to our room the wood of the door at the room beside was painted and still wet without any caution sign. As the aisle was very tight of course my 100 GBP black jacket turned into white...the whole night the paint was smelling and couldn't sleep very well... Night 3: as usual. Night 4: as we arrived in our room at midnight: the DOOR WAS OPEN!!! We hade may stuff within the room: clothes and money (EUR as our previous destination was Dublin)!!! I was immediately claiming at the reception where only apologizes were the answer and the receptionist told that it can happen sometimes! I told this is not normal and never saw any hotel where an open door waited me at arrival!!! Additional remarks: - no english breakfast -> two pieces of toast...in spite see the website where it seems you will get an english breakfast...if you read the small letters and click on a link you will notice this hotel is not a participating hotel - you need get a hairdryer from the reception... - you need to activate your card daily... - no vacuum cleaning during the 4 days

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the reveiws”
Reviews.Author: nataliegilligan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for a sight seeing visit to London, hotel was everything we needed and a complete bargain. If your in London then your not going to be spending all your time in your room, having said that, our room was perfectly fine - recently decorated, flat screen tv, (with all freeveiw channels) clean bathroom with a good shower and a working kettle :) It wasnt as noisy as other reveiwers made out, we slept with our window wide open all night and im a light sleeper and i still slept fine. Yes the hallways and reception are shabby but seriously unless you plan to spend your trip sat in the hall then why let it bother you. Its an ideal base for visiting London on the cheap - we only paid Â£88.00 for 2 nights with breakfast (basic tea and toast but edible) and it really was the cheapest place we could find and it only take 10 minutes on the tube to get into the center :) Would definitely use this place again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: VaJosh
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest... the only reason why you're considering this place is because it's cheap. Well, you get what you pay for. The service isn't great and if you have a room next to the road, make sure you bring your ear-plugs... but, it's clean and the rooms aren't horrible. (Don't believe hotels.com's description. Not all of the rooms have flat screen TVs and cable. My first night I was put into a single room with a tub TV with bunny ears on it. It got 6 channels and only a few of those came in clearly.) But again, if you're just looking for a clean place to stay for the night, this will work.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: k_t_brooker
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my Mother and cousin who were coming to visit me, I live locally. I went to the hotel and checked it out before I booked it, and found the rooms to be neat and clean, and the staff reasonably friendly. However, when my mother and cousin arrived off their long haul flight, they were made to wait 30 minutes before they could check in, whilst the entire staff sat out the back and had a smoke. The check in staff were rude and there was a light not working in the room (although this was relatively fixed quickly). We quickly began to refer to their accommodation as 'Fawlty Towers' after the TV show so that at least we had something to laugh about in what was generally an unpleasant experience. The room was hot and there was little ventilation, the window only opened a little. And when it closed, there was no locking mechanism, and as it looked out over roof tops, it didn't feel particularly secure. The room was clean, but small and pokey, nothing like the room I had viewed when I went to look before booking. The shower was over a bath tub that was so high, a pole vault was almost required to get in. Although the hotel was cheap, I would not recommend it, nor will I be booking other family members who may visit me, into it. It was close to the South Clapham Tube and pubs/resturants.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, just”
Reviews.Author: HHA2011
Reviews.Content: I'd stay again as it was only about Â£40 with breakfast for two people, you really do get what you pay for but I was expecting worse. Bet you could pay Â£60 elsewhere in the area and get the same, so not bad all round. GOOD: Location (right by the tube), breakfast ok, got upgraded (good job too), late notice availability, staff friendly enough, bed was good, sheets and towels clean and fresh, shower (there was one), kettle with tea and coffee etc... and the best water fountain you've ever seen in the front yard. BAD: Closed the window and the double glazing fell on my head, very noisy on the main road, cold, very odd room directions, 2 wake up calls didn't happen, overall decoration, tv didn't work never mind have Sky Sports 1 and 2 on, mouldy shower

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: hamhamham
Reviews.Content: Our room was not bad, but it wasn't good either. The TV was not working. The wi-fi was somewhat faulty. Our room is on the ground floor facing the main street, so it was very noisy at night. The breakfast was fine if you're not too picky (white and whole wheat bread, orange and apple juice, jam and butter, water, cereal). Have to go early as the eating place is not too big. The water in the bathroom worked fine. My daughter checked the beds about ten times for bed bugs (it was from one of the review that there's a sight of bed bugs) but to our relief thereâ€™s none. The location is not bad as well, since there were supermarkets and a tube station nearby (~5 minutes walk).

Reviews.Title: “Location and value great for o2 Brixton Academy, service average and a little rude”
Reviews.Author: Amit S
Reviews.Content: Location and value for money is very good, we went to a gig at the o2 academy Brixton. The room was advertsied as bed and breakfast, however it was a hot drink and toast! The staff behind reception were a little rude in the morning when we asked about breakfast, a grunt and a point is not what I would expect... The room was clean and functional however when we tried to switch on the storage heater, the wire was hanging of the plug so we gave the heater a wide berth! All in all, relatively good value for money in relation to the location and if you are going to a gig at the o2 academy Brixton. Cheers, Amit

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uli333
Reviews.Content: I liked this small hotel in london.i was 3 times before in london, so i know that the neighbourhood is not the fanciest one, but also not a bad one. it is not directly in the center, but just a lit bit outside in a not so crowdy place. the stuff was friendly and helpful.(gave me a cable to load my mobile for free). the room was not luxurious, but nice and not dirty at all. the beds were comfortable. itÂ´s between 2 subway station that r noth about 5-10 minutes to walk. the way to the ccenter is not far. there are supermarkets nearbye. i would recommend this hotel to everybody that wants to stay in london and doesnÂ´t want to spend much money for an apartment. cheap hotel, that is very clean,good service and nice rooms/good beds. thanks for the pleasant stay. regards and see u maybe soon. ULI

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: devine49
Reviews.Content: I write this as I am about to sign out of the dungeon, AKA one of the basement rooms. It's ok for one night, but if I had to come back here again tonight, it would be too depressing. As I have not seen the rooms on the upper floors, I can not let my experience of the dungeon knock this hotel. It's very clean, the DIY repairs are noticably DIY but like I said, you get what you pay for and my recommendation for this place would be short stay only

Reviews.Title: “Why are you all so negative? This is a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mev13
Reviews.Content: Stayed on enight with friends. Rooms were clean, quiet and warm. The doors had locks, The bathroom was clean and had towels. You can park your car round the corner if you ask the manager for the names of the specific roads. The breakfast was VERY basic but for the amount of money it cost (barely anything per night) I don't understand why everyone is so negative about this place. It is REALLY near Clapham South tube station. Ok, the receptionists were a little slow but they were polite and helpful (you get what you pay for) if your expectations are high don't stay there. This hotel does exactly what it says on the tin - 2 Star, cheap and cheerful. Some of the reviews on this website scared me so much I had to ring to try and cancel my stay however, I had left it too late and was not allowed! However, I am GLAD I stayed as the negative reviews were (in my opinion) a complete load of tosh.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: lifeoforeilly
Reviews.Content: I hadn't read the reviews on here until just now when I came to write mine own after an overnight weekend stay two nights ago. I reckon I wouldn't have stayed at all if I'd checked the place out on here beforehand!! But to be honest our experience was fine, no complaints. The staff were helpful when we asked. Our issues were just run of the mill stuff like asking for directions, bringing down an iron to the room and ordering taxis for us etc. But nothing was a hassle and was all sorted quickly for us. The room was clean and the bed (double bed - not two singles pushed together) was comfortable with small flat screen TV also. The shower was powerful (I really hate rubbish showers in hotels!) so all in all we were happy. We didnt have particularly high expectations given the price but all we wanted was something functional and clean. We stayed in room 82C which seemed to be not quite in the main building but an adjoining one so maybe these rooms are newer or better than the main building or something. There was a slight smell of damp in part of the corridor that we had to walk through to get to our room, but there was no smell in the room or elsewhere. Breakfast was very basic. Again I really didnt expect much for the price we were paying but it was literally just a choice of toast and cereal. Still, it did the job. Both my husband and I said we'd stay there again if we were going to Clapham again and wanted a cheap place to base ourselves for a night.

Reviews.Title: “good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmt82
Reviews.Content: first room we were given i asked to be moved as it looked like someone just had a shower b4 we got in room, room was dirty and so small. rm 8010. then we got moved to a "better" room, bed soft, but the noise and the curtains did not even shut but at least the room was warm, breakfast.. well that was toast and cereal with juice and tea/coffee.. staff could not wait for you to eat your "breakfast" b4 she was clearing up the table wether you had finished or not. manger was helpfull but the main recepionist well manners could not go a miss.. but you do get wat you pay for and it is so close to the tube it is handy. would book again but will ask for a better room away from road.

Reviews.Title: “RUN!”
Reviews.Author: missy090
Reviews.Content: First very RUDE manager! Second, room not ready when promised. Third, the room had a skeleton key to the door, which we found unlocked twice when returing to our room. Asked clerk about the lock being able to be unlocked by any other key in which he smiled and then said no. Yeah right! Bad smell inside of room, crappy furniture and a bed that was so old it had lumps! Couldn't get out of this place fast enough even though we lost money by leaving early. Do yourself a favor, don't stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price you pay!”
Reviews.Author: TravelWiz_85
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in London and it was perfect with a great location that is easy walking distance from the tube and bus stops. We booked this hotel before reading reviews, after reading most reviews we were regretting our choice. But we were definitely suprised-the hotel was great and I think people complaining had too high expectations for what they were paying. We arrived late at night and were greeted by friendly staff at the desk. It took a short time to find our room as we were pointed in the wrong direction but it was a simple mistake and the staff member was apologetic. The room was clean and cosy, not large but big enough. The bathroom was probably not as clean as it could have been but for the price we payed (86 pounds for 3 people for 2 nights) we wouldn't complain. The complimentary breakfast was great, all you can eat cereal, toast, tea, coffee and juice. Simple but all you need, and once again for the price you cannot complain. What we liked most was the closeness to transport, the breakfast and the awesome price. The worst was probably the cleanliness but not so bad that we found reason to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: dangermish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hovel, i mean hotel around 18 months ago, within weeks of returning home i was being bitten by something... having found 1 flea on the cat i presumed it was a flea infestation and have been treating (with no luck) ever since, this weekend we finally discovered a bedbug (they are good at hiding...especially in suitcases), pest control confirmed an infestation that had been here a long time. having read these reviews and hearing that people have been bitten and actually seen bedbugs in this dirty filthy hovel, i am in no doubt where they came from, infact i can think of no other place they could have come from. PLEASE BE CAREFUL IF STAYING HERE!! i have spent hundreds of pounds trying to get rid, for the amount i have paid out (not including the pain and constant itching plus mental torture) i could have spent the night at the ritz!! staying here was one of the biggest mistakes of my life!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Experience â€“run do not walk, in the other direction.”
Reviews.Author: Consultantgal
Reviews.Content: Stay at a Travel Lodge in London, just skip this hotel all together. The room was disgustingly filthy, but the worst was when the ceiling broke through at 2:30am and poured water straight on my head. The phone didnâ€™t work in my room so I dashed to reception in my nightgown and trench coat. The clerk did run back to the room with me and just started swearing â€“ funny, same reaction I had. He told me I must leave all my things there and gave me another room on another floor. That room did not have bedding so I had to go back to reception and was given a third room on the top floor. This room, while tiny (bed touched 3 walls) was very clean, updated and exactly what Iâ€™d expected as a London 3 star. Iâ€™d just dropped back to sleep and the fire alarm started going off every 10 minutes â€“ I ended up not sleeping and spending the night trying to find another hotel. In the morning I walked back down the 8 flights of stairs past everyone who was checking out â€“ Iâ€™m sure they thought my nightgown and trench coat outfit was lovely. I could not get back in the wet room where all my bags were left. So I had to go through the packed breakfast room to reception to get the key re-set, in my night gown and trench coat and socks â€“ with my now dry and disheveled hair; humiliating really. The fact that reception announced my hotel room number twice and put me in a room next to an outside door and with iron bars on the window and a foot away from a brick wall are hardly worth mentioning after the rest of it. I booked it as part of a package and was well aware that it was a 3 star property not a 5 star. I was still unprepared for the nightmare experience. Upon leaving the hotel, the cab driver told asked if I was unhappy and told me that he picks up lots of unhappy people from the hotel each week and felt the local council should actually shut it down. The room was filthy â€“ really filthy (see photos). The carpeting was just laid on the floor, bunched up along all the walls. There were so many lumps in the floor that it appeared to be laid directly over cobblestone. All of this would have been passable if the carpet was not visibly disgusting. The bath room floor had something seriously wrong with it as well, but it was difficult to tell what â€“ had they taken up the floor tiles, and just left the old ripped linoleum? There were three different colors of mold and mildew growing in every groove in the tile. This bath was so nasty even the soap was dirty in the paper wrapper!! The tiles were actually slumped in the shower and bulging out at the bottom. The shower tiles were cracked along the top. There was also a large crack in the ceiling over the shower. The hot and cold water handles (separate spigot for each) were switched, and there was no soap holder, no toilet paper holder and no towel bar. There were huge cracks in the walls - including the tiled shower walls, the electric outlets and switches were cracked and as mentioned, the phone in the room was dead. The breakfast that is included is tea and toasted white sandwich bread â€“ and you have to wait for the tea as they have one single kettle for the entire dining room. In the morning I spoke with the manager, showed him the original room and showed him all the details. He agreed completely apologized and said there were slowly renovating. The third room I stayed in was adequate, but with the fire alarms etc.. I checked out and moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It served a purpose”
Reviews.Author: LMDKent
Reviews.Content: I managed to book the last room in the hotel for a function I was attending nearby. This was a triple room, however if 3 people stayed in this room it would have been very entertaining as the 3 beds were all pushed together so to get on the other 2 beds you would have have to stand at the bottom of the bed and launch yourself onto it. The room was clean, which was all I really desired, although things were missing and falling off the furniture, such as drawer handles etc, and despite asking reception they could not find a remote control for the TV. I was only used my room for around 6 hours, so as I said it served a purpose, but certainly not a hotel of choice. Depending what you wanted this was a good base for me at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible "hotel"”
Reviews.Author: BeeGee71
Reviews.Content: We booked a room from Euro HOTEL Clapham, but they put us to Euro LODGE Clapham, even though the confirmation e-mail said hotel not lodge. Breakfast was just tea/coffee, toast and cornflakes. Very poor. The room was horrible, shower useless, bed uncomfortable. No fire alarm in the room. Check my photos....

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kassel_jones
Reviews.Content: I read beforehand some of the comments posted here but was pleasantly suprised that my room was fine. You do get what you pay for but the location is very good. Would recommend others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Cheap, great location”
Reviews.Author: statikLebanon
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was a very pleasant hotel in an excellent location. I was very pleased with my stay...

Reviews.Title: “Hazardous and risky”
Reviews.Author: Taxi1905
Reviews.Content: From out side the hotel looks great! Interior decoration was poor and deprived. On our second day we noticed that the breakfast area was shuffled around...fire exit was blocked, unreachable fire point (covered by huge toaster) fire extinguisher inexistent ...wow. After uncomfortable breakfast, I went to ask for the Manager; after a long and deep conversation we found out that she knew a lot about the health and safety but had no power in implementing it? As family we felt unsafe and think that the hotel is in breach of the law...a visit from the heath and safety officer will help to prevent a disaster! The staff and management were very professional and helpful but this is not enough to recommend your hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The experience was absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: LondonNutty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in August and the experience was absolutely horrible!!! We checked in around 10pm and we were allocated with a room in the basement facing the wall. A jail would have been much nicer. On top of that we also found out that the toilet was dirty. The bin had a sanitary towel bag in it and the soap was used as well. The bed looked like was not even made. I went upstairs immediately and spoke with one of the receptionists and complaint about the condition of the room. I asked her if we could change it but she said that the hotel was full and we had to wait until the next day. To donâ€™t mention that there was not hot water eitherâ€¦. The next day, while I was at work, my boyfriend informed me that he was suddenly awaken from the â€˜soundâ€™ of a drill just outside the room at 9am!!!! How can you do engineering work just outside of a guest room at 9 oâ€™clock in the morning?!?!? He went outside complaining about that but no one really caredâ€¦ That was really impressive.. At 12.30 pm we were assigned with another room at the top floorâ€¦ He then left the hotel and when we came back together, quite late in the evening, we had another surprise.. no hot water.. again!!! So the day after my boyfriend came downstairs to let you know that there was not hot water and your reception staff reassured him that something would have been done during the day so that at our return we could finally have a hot shower. Wellâ€¦ that was not the case.. When I came back at 6pm on the the problem was not fixed. I went downstairs and they first told me that the plumber had fixed the issue and then they told me that the plumber was at the hotel that day but he had a breathing problem and had to go to the hospital.. so he couldnâ€™t adjust it. What is the truth I donâ€™t really knowâ€¦ One person from the staff tried to fix the hot water. He came upstairs, did something and said that the hot water was going to be up and running in 30-45 minutes. He said that at 6.30pm.. At 7.30pm I went upstairs again to check if the hot water was back.. That was not the case.. again.. At this point I was really upset. I asked to have the room changed as the problem could have not been fixed and there was no other choiceâ€¦ I stayed at the hotel for 6 nightsâ€¦ changed 3 rooms.. had to use a dirty toilet.. and stayed for 2 nights without hot water.. The experience at the hotel was overall absolutely disgusting!!!! Please do not go there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for, simple standard, good location!”
Reviews.Author: SamSamDublin
Reviews.Content: As we had an early flight from Dublin to London, We arrived at the hotel before the 3pm check in time unfortunily our rooms were's not ready, there was no problem leaving our luggage but at our own "risk" .We had two rooms booked a twin and single, the reception did provide us with a triple room as they did not have two rooms beside one another, Our room was located on the 3rd floor, there was no lift so the stairs had to do, but was quite dangerious as the banster were very low! The reception was helpful at times. iron & board are not provided in the rooms had to call to reception to be told come down and get it ourselves. I also wanted to call home but then to be told the phone in the hotel only take call cards and had to walk 5mins up the road to a local pay phone. there was an information stand in the reception area, but didnt have that much tourist info about the city... As i was there on a girly cheap city holiday, we didnt spend that much time in the hotel, the 5 day's we where there, the first morning we decided to get up early to go down to breakfast (wish we had stayed in bed) the breakfast room was small and over crowed breakfast consist of 2 choice of cereal, bread you had to toast yourself! and horriable tea, from that day on we went out for breakfast. we only really wanted clean bed and room to stay, paying only 30 euro a night was a plus! wouldnt pay much more thou, positives our rooms was spacious double and single beds, The bathroom small but clean the shower head did fall down at times so had to hold it very arkward! . Rooms have t.v and hair dryer & mini fridge that ( did'nt work ) our room was serviced everyday with clean towls ect.. which was great! the room had a big balcony over looking clapham common park. its ideal location to the tube station and local shops.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!!”
Reviews.Author: lisamanics
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. It's without a doubt the worst I have ever stayed in. I have stayed in cheaper and nicer hotels in central London. Total rip off and I wasn't even paying full price! The carpet was dirty and covered in bits, there was mould and other people's pubic hairs in the shower and the room was so small, I felt like I was in a prison cell! I was woken by other guests being incredibly noisey at 1am and as ALL the doors in the hotel appear to creak horribly, even if they had been trying to be quiet, they would have made a racket. Breakfast was a shocker! Just cornflakes, Rice Krispies or toast. It's also set on a very busy road so you get traffic noise all night long. My advice? Don't stay here! Ever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Foul, Disgusting, Hell Hole”
Reviews.Author: EagleEyeVillain
Reviews.Content: After a 10 hour flight from Las Vegas I was ready to sleep anywhere. We needed to stay in London for one night for a family party before heading back to the Midlands. All we wanted was somewehre to sleep for one night. This place can only be descibed as a hostel/shelter for homeless peolpe. The guy at reception could not even find our room and led us to a half built section of the hotel, it smelt damp and had newspaper over the windows. When he finally found our room, the curtain rail was haging off, the room smelt of mildew, there were stains all over the sheets and tea stains in the bathroom. I turned to the guy who had shown us to our room and he had already vanished back to reception. I went back to reception and had a 45 min arguement with 3 different clueless Managers who said I could not have a refund as the room had been "used" and could not be given to anyone else. We had been in the room for 2 mins at the most so quite how it was "used" i don't know. I got a refund in the end but only after nearly busting a bolld vessel in frustration. The worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to enter, avoid at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “good Looking the park”
Reviews.Author: mm36
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay , though we did have too much information about london from reception as this was our first trip . It was very helpful and guided with all means of transportation and city centers trours at eaiest and how to get in cheap and easy way. Staff was friendly

Reviews.Title: “Absolute disgrace of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenkiwi
Reviews.Content: Dirty, basic, seedy, not going to bother writing much more but this is the worst hotel i've ever stayed in....Ok its Â£35 per night for a single room B&B but still one would expect more for your money. Don't stay here! the bathroom was an absolute joke as well...has to be seen to be believed. Whole place just awful, awful, awful....

Reviews.Title: “flea bites”
Reviews.Author: jaydaySorrento
Reviews.Content: when we checked in after a long journey the man at he desk was extremley rude and miserable' he showed us to our room which overlooked a yard full of junk and dirty matresses.The room was dirty and dusty the bedspread had stains on and the bottom sheet had hairs on .The shower had black mould aand did not work properly . Breakfast was disgustin the girl who did breakfast wore a tracksuit she looked miserable had her fingers in her mouth then she gave bread out .to cap it all i got bitten whilst laid on the bed. Never again .

Reviews.Title: “absolutely disgusting”
Reviews.Author: tonitrubliciouz
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night for a night out in london the room had damp patches all over the floor and stunk of damp and we coudlnt even open the window to let the stench out. the bathroom had tiling falling off the walls. the carpet was really manky and old and it looked like an old peoples home in the hotel. both the bedroom and bathroom door wouldnt close properly. when speakin to the receptionist he couldnt even understand what i was saying. i am going to complain. the room was only 40 pounds but it was unbearable

Reviews.Title: “wot a bunch of cowboys avoid it like hell”
Reviews.Author: saz663
Reviews.Content: my sister booked the hotel with her card and i paid er the cash. we were charged 130 quid for two nites in a double.when we arrived at the hotel we had expected it to be paid for as my sis gave them er card details earlier in the year.we were told that it hadnt come off the card and we had to pay upon arrival(y they didnt tell us this in the first place i dunt no. my sis stayed in the lodge and me and my partner stayed in the main hotel. The staff were very unfriendly they didnt seem to want to help us and spend most of there time looking down theyre nose at us. we then were given the key to our room if thats wot u can call it. it happened to be at the top of four flights of stairs on which theyre was no lift and i had to carry a 20kg suitcase and no lights on a nite except for the emergency lighting. this ment it was hard to find our footing and put the key in the lock. the room was super small the bathroom consisted of a trough which was supposed to be a shower and it was that small 1 person could only fit in the bathroom. the hot water took 10mins to get hot mayb even longer. the staff never cleaned the room once and we had to get toilet paper from the toilet on the stairs. wen i went downstairs to ask for coffee and milk as they didnt replenish it in the room it took them 30 mins to find it and wen they did they put it in two cups. the breakfast was just cereal and toast and the coffee at breakfast was minging. at my sisters 1 the lodge eurostar they had the heating on full n the windows didnt open also all the cups were dirty we wud neva go bak and they were lucky i didnt punch em striaght in the mouth the way they acted towards us. also the eurostar hotel also used to be called the dudley hotel am not sure but they may have changed the name due to all the crap publicity avoid this hotel a travel lodge in the city is the same price n much nicer

Reviews.Title: “If you like small then this is for you”
Reviews.Author: Gudday
Reviews.Content: Didn't think much of the person on reception he was more interested in looking at the internet than serving me. The room was the size of a cupboard and the bed was less than a single with squeeky springs. The room faced the road so was lite up by the hotel lights and you could hear everything from the street. Took over 5 minutes before any hot water came through on the shower. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “OK IN A PINCH”
Reviews.Author: stuball9999
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel before check in was allowed so we left our bags. When we arrived back later in the day and went to our room we were disappointed. The shower was in disrepair and could have used a new plaster job. There was (in my opinion) termite damage that was rather unsightly. The room was clean but the TV didn't work well. There was an exposed wire being used as the antenna. As I said in my opening, the hotel is OK in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst...Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Enzzo
Reviews.Content: Right...let's start. I and my girlfriend decided to stay 4 days in London last weekend (20-23.06.08). We found this hotel in internet, E Dreams, and of course it marvellous in the pictures. Nice building, nice rooms, pretty clean and modern. We thought that the low prices for the rooms were actually related to the position of the hotel, which is pretty far from the centre, and we decided to book a double room...WORST DECISION OF OUR LIVES!!! When we arrived it was very late at night and we were really tired to go for any change. First we realized that the pictures of the building were maybe taken 50 years ago, because the construction is really old and not cared...First negative point. We got in and the receptionist, a cold and unfriendly person, gave us the key. We got in the room and...we REALLY REALIZED THE HUUUUUGE MISTAKE WE'VE DONE!!! The room wasn't so small, but if i say that it was filthy i am making an enormous compliment to it. All the furnitures were partially broken down and everything was full of old dust that was there since ages. The window was broken...we had luck to go there in june when it was not so cold and we didn't have to use the bed sheets...which were full of hairs of previous lucky guests. The bathroom was small...really small, and the shower box was full of mold. We slept very bad in there. The next moorning we had the "continental breakfast" in a room full of old cereals in the floor. Two pieces of NOT roasted bread, a bit of jam (no choice...only strawberry jam if you like it...) and a coffee served in a dirty cup (I am not joking...even the cup was dirty). At the end of the breakfast...at which we didn't eat anything, we decided to run away in order not to transform our vacation in a nightmare. Of course we didn't get the money back (everything was payed at the beginning) for the rest of the days that we were NOT going to spend at that place and we had to go to a tourist information point where we found a confortable small hotel near Victoria station that costed us just a bit more, but that was much much MUCH better. My suggestion? If we hadn't left that hotel our vacation would have been awful, so...just do NOT think only about the money when you book a hotel through internet. Sometimes 20â‚¬ more per night make a BIG difference in terms of having a good time in the place you stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but horrible”
Reviews.Author: Natira
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late in the night, and I found it a bit weird that we had to pay up front, but I didn't give it any second thought at the time. The room we got was tiny and it was facing a very busy street. The lights they have pointed at the hotel to light it up didn't help. The beds were bad, so bad in fact that my brother and his girlfriend who also stayed at the hotel had to swap hotels after two nights. They only had one working light bulb in their room, and when complaining were told they could be given one so they could swap themselves... Their window wasn't isolated properly either. When they informed the hotel they were leaving, they were told that they hadn't complained enough - they complained three times or so, about three different matters. At first, I didn't give the problems too much thought. The bed was bad, but I didn't have any problems sleeping. Sure - the room was tiny, but it was a cheap room. However - we soon realised a few things: 1. They didn't change the bed coverings once during our entire stay. 2. We never got new towels. One time I actually put them on the floor in front of the door to make my point, it only resulted in towel number three (the smallest and by this time dirtiest) disappeared - and it wasn't replaced. 3. We had to go to the reception to get more toilet paper, and the member of the staff who helped, fetched it from a nearby toilet. 4. One time we got back, the toilet paper had some poo smeared on it... 5. The breakfast was only two pieces of toast, and for the most part they only had one type of jam to go along - do I even need to say we didn't bother having breakfast there too often? 6. We could see the staff arguing between themselves on a few occasions. Service was bad, complaints weren't paid attention to and the hygiene was lacking from the hotels side. The only positive things I can say is that it was located close to a tube station within zone 2 and it was very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy. Never again.”
Reviews.Author: beachlover30
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Euro Hotel Groups hotels on many occasions in London and been satisfied. I thought I would try this due to its location. How wrong I was. Had a single room which was no bigger than a cupboard. That is OK however, I can do small but I can not do filth. Cleaning materiels don't cost the earth. The bed linen was clean as was the sink, the toilet and the shower - sort of. The rest was disgusting. Under the bed were nail clippings. I really am no snob and realise this is cheap. I don't ask for superb fittings, things can be hanging of the walls for all I care but dirt I don't do. Never again! No parking either except a back yard.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for ... what do you expect for these prices???”
Reviews.Author: WereLondondaft
Reviews.Content: After reading the review on here i was terrified of stepping foot in what sounds like a hell hole in London! but now i do not have a clue what all the fuss was about! Me and two of my friends stayed in a triple room in this hotel for a Friday and Saturday night in March 2008. The staff were friendly, the room was nice, the bedding and towels etc were all perfectly clean, our TV did plug in, our wardrobe opened, they didnt mind us checking out a little late, and there were no bed bugs! Yes the bathroom was small and not exactly first class, there was building work going on next door (but never noisy), the breakfast is simple but edible, the room didnt have much natural light and it was a bit of a squeeze getting into the room past the dresser .... but really ... what do you expect from the prices your paying to stay here?? The location is also brilliant ... right on the common, 5 mins walk from the subway, lots of pubs/clubs/restaurants and local shops on your door step and as three girls we felt completely safe (and didnt see any beware of thief signs?). We loved it and will be going back again in April if we can get a vacancy. Saying that we were there for a weekend of partying and no i wouldnt recommend it for a romantic get away ... but really if your looking for a romantic get away you should be looking to pay a little bit more for your room! no?? All in all (unless we were in the only decent room in the hotel?) definately worth the money and i recommend to any young people who are on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “What a joke”
Reviews.Author: waterfordmma
Reviews.Content: Should have read the reviews here before staying. What a big mistake. Myself and my girlfriend booked a room over the phone, we found the hotel quite easily and check in was quite fast. Thats about as positive as this review gets. We were told before we went upstairs that we would have to give in our key before leaving, when i asked why this is, i was informed that guests once left, got copies cut and gave them away or sold them to locals. . . . That sure put my mind at rest. The stairs were very steep and narrow, the hallway to get to our room was just as narrow, as for the room itself : bed was uncomfortable, you could feel all the springs, the duvet was hidden away in the press, the curtains would not close, if you attempted to close them, they fell off, the tv was tiny, the aerial could only pick up two channels, even so it was very bad reception, no remote either, the room was very cramped, you couldn't move around in the room without tripping over the bed, the room was tidied in the mornings but over a 3 night stay but was not cleaned once, which means we had to use the same sheets on the bed, the same towels, and the tea/coffee supply was not refreshed. The bathroom, the room was about the size as two toilet cubicles, the room was very damp, when showering you were forced to choose between very cold or very hot water, ther was no inbetween temperature. Horrible horrible experience. We were forced to pay the full amount on check in and when we asked the front desk if they knew any good places for food they directed us to the phone book. How helpful. I'm not very willing to agree that the location was very safe either as while we were there, there was a lot of signs in the area warning people that there had been a lot of theft in the area recently and it asked people who had seen anything to contact a certain number. Avoid this place like the plague !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: haylin
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying the Euro Clapham (80-81 Clapham Common South Side, Clapham, London, SW4 GDL) last October 2007. We booked over the internet looking for budget accommodation and we must say that despite the negative reviews, we found this hotel very nice. It was quiet, (some of the rooms in front of the main busy road may get a little noisy though), well-located next to the Clapham South tube station (5 minutes walk), so about 20 minutes from Trafalgar Square on the northern line. Reception is open 24h/24 and the keys stay at the hotel. The Clapham Common South area is nice, including the large park right across from the hotel, restaurants and bars close by, as well as both a Tesco and a Sainsbury supermarkets nearby. The double room we got was actually quite large, simple but nice furniture, comfortable bed, television, cute balcony and a small, but clean bathroom. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was simple: toasts, butter/jam, coffee/tea, milk and cornflakes. A friend who was travelling with us got double bedroom, witch was very much like ours. Another friend stayed at the Euro Lodge Clapham (just 2 minutes walk from this hotel) in a single quite small and simple room, but clean, fairly quiet and with a larger bathroom. There was indeed some old furniture and an old mattress past the reception on the way to her room, as there were some works and refits being done. In a nutshell we can say that we really enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Euro Clapham; itâ€™s nice, clean, close to the city and yet affordable and good value for the money. We would definitely come back again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: gatlinburgdiva
Reviews.Content: Despite the negative reviews, I found this hotel nice. It was fairly quiet, well-located next to the Clapham South tube station, and a good value for the money. The cornflakes for breakfast were good, and I liked the toast. It wasn't luxurious, but comfortable and pretty clean. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Euro 'hotel'!!”
Reviews.Author: visittoeurohotel
Reviews.Content: I had the great misfortune to stay in the Euro 'hotel' recently. Yes, good price and location, however, you might be more comfortable on a park bench on Clapham common! On arrival i was told that the hotel owned several nearby houses which were used as guest accomodation. I was told to go out the back door and was given directions to the house - my room was on the ground floor. On following these instructions, i came accross a very delapidated house with a front door swung open with no lock. There was an overgrown garden with kebab wrappers and litter on the path to the front door. Just inside the door, piles of various previous residents mail and free newspapers etc lay uncollected over the floor. There was then a second door with no lock leading to a corridor of rooms. Each room door had a number scrawled on it with a marker pen. On entering my room, there was rank and musty smell. I guess the previous guest had been frightened to open the window to let fresh air in, due to its ground floor location, as well as the odour old and foosty furninishings. The carpet was akin to a that of a pub with various stains and marks. There wasn't even a proper bed - rather a sofa bed. Yes, there was an ensuite, colour tv, kettle with tea, coffee and milk, what seemed to be clean sheets and towels (although i wasn't totally convined of that). I had an uneasy nights sleep, not least that the door and window locks where easily broken. Needless to say, i didn't hang around to sample the breakfast! Judging by the clientelle encountered on returning my key, it would appear that the Euro is used to house asylum seekers as bed and breadfast accomodation - i truly feel sorry for them. A grim encounter, indeed!! :-(

Reviews.Title: “Generally would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: ninks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights beginning September 6th 2007. Pros: *In a fairly decent area of London, close to the Clapham South tube station *Across the street from a park *Near Tesco and Sainsbury Local (which I would reccomend over Tesco -- better hours and faster, nicer service) *They cleaned a room for me and allowed me to check in before 2pm Cons: *They gave me a hard time about not having a voucher. *When I first walked in I was told a room would not be ready till 2pm -- it was 1130am and I was jet lagged and needed to rest. I told him I would wait, and I think they just wanted to get me out of the lobby. *They keep all of the room keys at the front desk in cubby holes that ANYONE has access to. The front desk is NOT always attended. The room numbers are clearly marked on the keys. They INSISTED that you leave your key when you left the building -- no matter what. I am suprised that NO ONE mentioned this as it is a major security problem. My luggage was kept locked and cable locked to the heater (an attached fixture) *Room was tiny *Bathroom floor tiles were disgusting *Bathroom had mold all over the place. The solution was simple -- a little bleach would have taken care of all of it, it was all over the shower and even on the walls. I brought Lysol with me and Clorox wipes after I read the reviews here *I was given ONE towel *There were times when that one towel was wet *I was not given toilet paper once *I had to ask them to change my sheets

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Levis
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel (if you can indeed call it a hotel) I have ever had the misfortune to stay at. We arrived a little later than we expected (at 9pm) when we were advised that our room was not yet ready. Bearing in mind check-in should have been noon I thought this seemed a little odd. After a few moments haggling to try and get in the room we were shown to what can only be described as a broom cupboard with two single beds in it (not good when we asked for a room with 3 beds in it). We refused to stay in the room and asked what else they had available. We were then showed to another room, which was not even part of the main hotel building, but which we had no choice but to accept. The double bed was in fact a sofa bed and there was a third single bed. There was a terrible smell of damp in the building, no shower curtain on the shower, no lights, no duvets on the "beds", electrical hazards everywhere and even pest traps dotted around the room. There was also no hairdryer or trouser press (as promised in the description on the internet). That evening, whilst trying to drink to forget, we coincidentally met a group of people who had also made a reservation with this hotel. They told us that after seeing what was on offer, they immediately went off to find somewhere else to stay (yes, it REALLY was that bad). The next morning, after a very poor nights sleep (we were too scared to go to sleep, despite the copious amounts of alcohol we had drunk!) we got up and went to reception to complain. I was advised to write down my complaint and was told that I wouldn't have to pay for the room. On checking my credit card statements the following week, I noticed they had taken the money from my credit card anyway. After several conversations with the hotel, they agreed to refund some of the money. I still feel as though I have been robbed! So please, anyone who is considering staying in this hotel, dont! Its a terrible, terrible place and how they get away with calling themselves a hotel under the trades descriptions act is beyond me. Find somewhere else to stay! Please note this is the polite, edited version!! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Ants, Smells & One sided Toast! Cheap, but cheap!”
Reviews.Author: andymook
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and for a cheap price you get exactly thatâ€¦a cheap hotel! Hotel staff were clueless yet polite enough, giving out the wrong keys a few times, giving us somebody elseâ€™s room, giving us perhaps the worst breakfast I had ever had at a hotel (toast â€“ only toasted on one side, nasty OJ and half a small cup of tea). There was a wait at breakfast as there wasnâ€™t enough cutlery and plates, so the only girl serving had to keep looking out for people who had finished eating and then go and get there dirty stuff and give it a wash before giving you your breakfast! We only had it one day, we didnâ€™t bother the second! We didnâ€™t have the cereal that was offered (cornflakes) but perhaps thatâ€™s as well, as the American lady sat at the table next to us to find out her daughters milk was also off! Whilst our room wasnâ€™t the cleanest, most well kept/maintained and most fragrant freeâ€¦it was a palace compared to our friends single room (we had booked one room for all 3 â€“ but I think they had given it away). He had ants in his room (one crawled on him at night), it stunk of old people and sewage (sorry, not very PC), was smaller than my bathroom and was in need of a good clean and maintenance. I donâ€™t know how he slept there, seriously! We offered him our floor, but then again, thinking about our carpet, Iâ€™m not sure what the safer option was! On a brighter note, it was cheap, It was close to the tube (though use the South station, itâ€™s closer than the one advertised), has a Tesco and nice cafÃ©â€™s nearby, it was quiet (apart from guests complaining about smells and no water in rooms) and faces a lovely pond and park! They also opened the bar to get us beers after a great last night at a concert, at which point almost all was forgiven!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Gerna
Reviews.Content: We needed somewhere to stay for about 3 weeks while we waited to move into a new home. Location was perfect for us and the price was right! We ended up leaving after three days. The windows didn't shut so we were kept awake with traffic noise all night. The hotel is on a very busy road. The curtains didn't cover the windows either so we had street lights shining in our window. The bed was narrow, uncomfortable and clammy. Bleh! The bathroom was unclean. The whole room was clearly very old and run down; in desperate need of a refurb. Staying there for us while trying to work and live our daily lives was uncomfortable and depressing. We've both travelled on a shoestring many times and have never encountered anything so substandard. Don't ruin your holiday to save a few pounds - stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Porchguy
Reviews.Content: I was very sceptical about staying at this hotel based on the unbelievably inexpensive rate at which I managed to book the room (42 pounds per night). The negative reviews I read in advance also gave me cause for concern. I have to say, however, that overall my experience with the hotel was a pleasant surprise. As I arrived in London early in the morning, I was hoping to get into our room early to take a power nap, and get ready to meet my partner who was arriving later that day. I arrived at the hotel at about 10:00 a.m., and the the front desk receptionist was helpful and able to arrange for a double room to be serviced and made available to me within the hour. While the room was dull and small, it was clean apart from a couple of small oil stains on the carpet and everything worked fine for the five nights we stayed there. And even though I had to take a basement room as that was the only one available at the time of my early arrival, it had a nice big window that opened to allow in enough daylight and fresh air. The room also had a nice-sized fridge with a freezer which I was not expecting and which came in handy during the 5-night stay. After having tried the breakfast which consisted of white toast and weak coffee, we opted not to have breakfast at the hotel again, but for 42 pounds per night we were not expecting much anyway as far as the breakfast was concerned. The location itself was excellent with easy access to the London Underground and various bus routes. The Clapham Common South area is nice, including the large park right across from the hotel, restaurants and bars close by, as well as both a Tesco and a Sainsbury grocery store nearby. The street was noisy at night with both drunken bar patrons shouting at sporadic times throughout the night, as well as the London police and ambulance sirens that go on at all hours of the night. It didn't really bother us too much though, and we opted to leave the window open all night for fresh air anyway. In conclusion, for 42 pounds per night for a double room, I found the hotel excellent value and would stay there again next time in London, if on a low-budget trip. This is why I have given the hotel an above-average rating.

Reviews.Title: “TICS / BED BUGS crawling on our faces!”
Reviews.Author: ClaphamLocal
Reviews.Content: This would be the most TERRIBLE experience I have ever had in my life...and I am a worldly traveller having stayed in the most budget of budget hostels! This review on BELVEDERE HOTEL (EURO HOTEL CLAPHAM) is long but that is how bad it was - definitely worth the read...especially on the TICS / BED BUGS!! I'm a local in Clapham however I needed a room for 3nights as my partner was flying in from Italy and unfortunately I only rent a small single room. Hence I explained this with the hotel staff saying I was looking for a local hotel to do a regular monthly booking - this obviously didn't seem to have any impact on them! Firstly when we arrived we had to pay for all 3nights upfront which I did feel a bit uncomfortable with however I assumed it would be ok. Big mistake! The room was very basic - however we expected that. But never did we expect to compromise our health! The bathroom was incredibly small and Iâ€™m amazed they fit a toilet in that space. The door needed to be left open. We decided to have showers but quickly discovered that there was no hot water. So eventually the staff advised that there were no other rooms available and that we would need to use the shower in a different single room on our floor whilst we stayed there! Then once coming home from dinner at 1.00am I was in bed and whilst my partner was preparing to get into bed he noticed something crawling on the pillow. We lifted up the pillow and a plague of TICS / BED BUGS came rushing out. It was the most disgusting sight I had ever seen and I was almost physically sick - not to mention that we were scratching ourselves and checking each others head for TICS that may have got in there! We asked hotel staff to come to the room immediately and in the interim I took photos. The man apologised and said I would be able to get a refund for that night. I informed him that we would not be staying in THAT room and unfortunately at 1.30am in the morning there aren't too many options as to where you can go - and also I already knew that hotels in that area were completely booked out for the weekend. Mysteriously a room became available at 2am in the morning (remembering that earlier when our shower wasn't working they said there were completely booked out!). So we had to pack up all our suitcases and get dressed and move to another floor at 2am in the morning! Needless to say after changing rooms we did not sleep at all as the sensation of the TICS/BED BUGS crawling on our faces was too vivid! Then in the morning we heard loud sounds of water dripping in our bathroom. I investigated the sound and was shocked to find the bathroom floor full of puddles as there was water leaking from the room above and coming through our ceiling! In the morning when I went downstairs to discuss this horrible experience and to organise the refund that I had been promised the night before - I was informed by the new day staff that due to the fact that another room was provided to us they had decided to not provide us with our promised refund for the first night stay! I asked to speak to the manager however he told me that the manager did not have time to speak to me! Unfortunately we had no where else to go and as stated I had already paid in full for the 3nights. So I really had no options and they played on that. I cannot believe that in 2007 a consumer does not have any rights and that this inefficiently run establishment believed they could set their own rules in London and they did! They did not care that I stated I would take this further and that I had taken photos of the TICs / BED BUGS as well as have witnesses. Actually he laughed at me and invited me to take it further - he was incredibly disrespectful. After the 3rd day of requesting to speak to the manager - and receiving the same response that the manager was too busy to speak to me - he informed me that he could provide me with a pathetic 25pound refund and that would be it! Needless to say we stayed outside of the hotel for the remaining time and only went there to sleep for a minimal 6hrs and we ensured that we laid down towels on the bed first to sleep on. The worst experience of my life - but more so from a point of view of being robbed of your consumer rights and realising that you had no power to do anything because THEY had set their own rules - and you were insignificant because they had already received your money! I have never been one to read reviews as I never really understood their purpose - but now I do! Also for the fact of paying an extra 10pounds a night in another hotel it really is worth it! Please do consider this review strongly as it is not worth taking the risk - as Iâ€™m assuming the room with TICs/BED BUGS was rented out the next night - as I cant imagine a new mattress/pillows being bought!!

Reviews.Title: “A cheap option... but don't expect luxury!”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Clapham, South London, about 20 minutes from Trafalgar Square by underground on the northern line. The neighborhood is ok, some nice pubs and a great Pakistani restaurant. The rooms are... well...barely good. BAthroom was ok (nothing special of course), bed was ok... that's it. Everything else - from windows' finitures to ceiling - is very tired and in deep need of a total reshape but - said this - the place is a good option for budget and young travellers. We got a deal on www.booking.com, only 40 GBP per room per night at New Year's Eve time! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Do not expect anything from breakfast. It's a small continental one, served only 'til 9:00 am during weekdays. But - again - I wouldn't discourage young people who don't need any special comfort from chosing this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Euro Hotel Clapham
HotelInfo.Address: 80-81 Clapham Common South Side | Clapham, Lambeth, London SW4 GDL, England
